intro: Blitum capitatum, commonly known as the common bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a bluish or purplish hue. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, round seeds.
